body.p: The lymphatic system is unique because it serves the body in two very important ways. How? Select the best answer.

multiple_choice.choice: The lymphatic system helps the body by fighting against infectious agents and looking for abnormal cells that may cause cancer
The lymphatic system both provides immunity and helps the tissues to keep proper fluid and molecular balance
The lymphatic system drains fats from the intestinal track and it can sometimes cause autoimmune diseases
The lymphatic system helps clean up cellular debris and dead bacteria while defining your own personal tissue type

feedback.p: Incorrect. These are two functions of the immune system which is part of lymphatic function but ignores the role of the lymphatic vessels in fluid and electrolyte balance.
Correct. This answer describes the big picture of lymphatic function.
Incorrect. These are two functions of the lymphatic system but do not include all the others.
Incorrect. These are two functions of the immune functions of the lymphatic system but do not include the roles of the lymph vessels.

body.p: The lymphatic system contributes to the body’s homeostasis by performing which of the following functions?

multiple_choice.choice: Providing defense against invading foreign organisms
Surveying for abnormal cells that could cause cancer
Draining fluids away from the tissues and returning them to the blood
Helping to move large molecules around the body

feedback.p: Incorrect. This is only one of the important contributions the lymphatic system makes to homeostasis.
Incorrect. Cancer prevention is only one important function.
Incorrect. While this function is essential it doesn’t take immunity into account.
Incorrect. This is very important for tissue homeostasis but ignores the rest of the body.
Correct. These are all important functions.

body.p: Sometimes when people have undergone extensive surgical or radiation procedures they experience abnormal levels of swelling and edema in the affected region. This complication is not from the disease but a result of the treatment. What is the best explanation?

multiple_choice.choice: The treatment has changed the molecular balance of their tissues and water has entered due to osmosis
The IV that was inserted in their arm during the procedure put too much fluid in their system
The lymph vessels were destroyed during the procedure and they can no longer drain the affected region properly
A parasite has gotten into their body and clogged up a lymphatic vessel

feedback.p: Both of these treatments are physically disruptive and should not change the molecular content of the remaining healthy tissue
Incorrect. If the IV added too much fluid to their system the person would experience overall swelling and edema not just swelling and edema in the affected body part
Correct. If the lymphatic vessels are destroyed they cannot properly drain the tissue
Not the best answer. This scenario does actually happen but in this case it is more likely that the procedures destroyed the lymph vessels.
